alert.note: Alert for City of Richmond; Hanover; Henrico; New Kent (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 07 at 5:53PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 745 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of central Virginia and east central Virginia, including the following counties and independent city, in central Virginia, City of Richmond, Hanover and Henrico. In east central Virginia, New Kent. * WHEN...Until 745 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 553 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Richmond, Highland Springs, Mechanicsville, Virginia Union University, Virginia Commonwealth University, Downtown Richmond, East Highland Park, Bottoms Bridge, Lakeside, Fair Oaks, Sandston, Richmond International, Montrose, Orapax Farms, Westwood, Chamberlayne, Quinton and Dumbarton. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.

area.areaDesc: City of Richmond; Hanover; Henrico; New Kent
